projects.name: Front-End Development - Javascript
projects.Description: After diving into the fundamentals of programming, students get comfortable with JavaScript basics, interacting with the DOM, and event listeners

projects.name: Front-End Web Applications
projects.Description: Students learn React, an object-oriented JavaScript framework, and have the opportunity to pick up key industry skills by building a project that interacts with an API.

projects.name: Back-End Development
projects.Description: Students gain a thorough understanding of back-end development basics, using languages such as Ruby,before getting comfortable with object-oriented programming and storing information in databases using SQL and Object Relational Mappers.

projects.name: Back-End Web APIs
projects.Description: First, students will learn Rails - an object-oriented, Ruby framework, before using it to create their own JSON API along with productive, scalable front-ends with React and Redux, creating slick, functional, reactive code.

projects.name: Cumulative Project
projects.Description: After completing four curriculum phases focused on group projects, students work with instructors to come up with solo project concepts and spend dedicated time building truly sophisticated applications on their own. Students receive plenty of instructor feedback along the way, while diving deep into various advanced technologies needed to bring their concepts to life.
